HE THEN BROUGHT ALL AFFECTED MATERIAL BACK TO DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL PROCEDURE.

item.title: Report E-2024010342
item.description:
Report E-2024010342

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-22T15:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: BRUNSWICK
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SAFETY-KLEEN SYSTEMS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: This was the last pick up for the day and when the driver was doing his pick up the customer added more paint waste to the drum and he loaded it on his truck. The drive was about an hour back to the facility to unload for the end of the day. He arrive at approximately 1730 and when he opened the door to unload they noticed the drum was swelling up. The team at the facility emidiatly called for a team to come out and and address the container. The drum expanded to the point of failure at about 1830 before the team could arrive to address the situation. The bottom of the container failed and the contents was released into the truck with around 10 gallons making it to the pavement. They were able to contained it with absorbents and booms from spreading. The team arrived around 1930 to perform the clean up. They dawned the proper PPE and proceeded to clean up the material and overpacking the container to be shipped and disposed of properly. The crew was able to complete this around 2200.

item.title: Report E-2024010358
item.description:
Report E-2024010358

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-22T15:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a 2gal release of UN1307, Unisol® Liquid Red B, from a 55gal metal drum on the dock. The cause was due to a forklift accident. The SDS was reviewed with terminal personnel who felt comfortable cleaning the release with oil dri and proper PPE. Terminal personnel placed the waste into a 65gal poly drum in the facilities waste area for them to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024010201
item.description:
Report E-2024010201

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-05
  • City: NORWALK
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 5, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon liter plastic jugs of UN3149 leaked due to improper loading and released approximately one (1) liter of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel collected and containerized all impacted cardboard and debris into one (1) vented 55-gallon poly drum. The two (2) damaged 5-liter jugs were placed into one (1) other vented 55-gallon poly drum. Both drums were labeled as hazardous and staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

item.title: Report E-2024010286
item.description:
Report E-2024010286

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-11
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 11, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was punctured and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbents and cleaners to remediate the site. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged drum was patched and placed into one (1) 85-gallon drum. Crews secured the scene and demobilized.

item.title: Report E-2024010332
item.description:
Report E-2024010332

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-19T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a spill of 1gal of Chemlok 205 (UN1133) from one 5gal metal pail which was punctured by a forklift during dock ops at XCO spilling to the dock floor. The SDS for the material was reviewed with the terminal and it was determined that the terminal could safely clean the spill with the PPE available on site, storing the total waste into one 35gal poly drum and left in the terminal waste area.

item.title: Report X-2024010238
item.description:
Report X-2024010238

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: CERTIFICATED PERSONNEL INFORMED OF DISTRESSED PACKAGE. SHIPMENT TAKEN OUT OF SYSTEM FLOW, NOTED LIQUID RELEASE CONTAINED TO PACKAGE. DISTRESSED PACKAGE CONTAINED IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED WET AND UPON INSPECTION, THE BOTTOM HAS A PUNCTURE THAT ALLOWED LEAKAGE TO HAPPEN. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: BOTTLE WAS PLACED UPSIDE DOWN TO MITIGATE SPILLAGE
